Elshan is 41 years old, married, and the father of one daughter. 

Elshan is a well known fruit seller in his town. He has dedicated 10 years of his life to this activity. Elshan says, "I love my business because it is my only source of income.” 

He has a need to expand his business by buying fruit trees and getting more lands for cultivation so that he can get his daughter married. Now his first goal is the fruit business, from which he takes care of the financial needs of his family.

Now it is summer time and he needs more variety of fruits because of increasing demand. He needs a 1,800 AZN loan in order to bring in more fruit stock. He has a good loan history and this is his fifth loan. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to bring in more fruit stock for the summer.

loans.name: Agblegno-Ekpui-Kpolozimé-Vogan Group

texts.fr: Monsieur  Kodjovi est agriculteur.  Âgé de 51 ans, il est marié et a à sa charge 10 enfants dont la moitié est scolarisée. Il a déjà obtenu un prêt chez WAGES. Cet homme est à la tête d’une entreprise de 6 salariés. Il espère diversifier son activité avec ce crédit. En effet, il compte acquérir de nouvelles terres. De plus, il compte acheter une quantité important de palmier pour augmenter sa production de sodabi. Son projet a ensuite pour but d’améliorer le quotidien de sa famille, de pouvoir assurer une scolarité à ses enfants. Monsieur Kodjovi est le responsable du groupe GP AGBLEGNO – Ekpui –Kpolozimé – VOGAN. Les onze autres membres du groupe sont pratiquement à l’image de leur responsable, avec les mêmes objectifs et des montants de prêts presque égaux. Ces agriculteurs espèrent bénéficier au maximum de l’opportunité offerte par WAGES.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjovi, age51, is a farmer. He's married and has ten children to support, half of whom go to school. He already obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES. He runs a six-employee company. Thanks to this loan, he hopes to diversify his business.

Indeed, he intends to acquire new land. Furthermore, he intends to buy a large quantity of palm trees, in order to increase his "sodabi" production (sodabi is an alcoholic beverage made out of palm tree sap). His project's goal is then to improve the daily life of his family, and ensure his children receive and education.

Mr. Kodjovi is responsible for Agblegno – Ekpui –Kpolozimé – Vogan Group. The elven other members are just like their leader. They share the same goals and each will receive an almost equal share of the loan.

These farmers hope to get the most of the opportunity provided by WAGES.

loans.use: to buy farm input

loans.name: Reyna Celina

texts.es: La Señora Reyna trabaja para una escuela publica de primaria desde hace mas de 7 años como maestra con niños desde 7 - 9 años, actualmente esta cursando una carrera técnica la que le servirá de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia ya que tendrá mejor oportunidad de ingreso y superación,solicita  a ceprodel un crédito para el pago de esos gastos.
texts.en: Señora Reyna has worked for a public elementary school for over seven years as a teacher of children ages 7-9. She is currently taking a technical degree that will be of great benefit to her and to her family, since she will have better career and earning potential. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to pay these costs.

loans.use: to pay diploma processing and fees.

loans.name: Violeta Silvia

texts.es: La Señora violeta trabaja para una escuela publica como maestra desde hace mas de 15 años, actualmente le están realizando una mejora en su casa de habitación elaborando una pared perimetral para obtener mayor seguridad y bienestar de ella y su familia, solicita a ceprodel un crédito para realizar esa mejora.
texts.en: Señora Violeta has worked for a public school as a teacher for over 15 years. Repairs are currently being made to her home. A wall is being built around the perimeter for better security and for her family's well-being. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to make this improvement.

loans.use: to buy bricks for a wall.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is 32-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health care. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant, but his income is insufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income. She has been in the business of sewing for a period of about four years. She is quite familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation, when she took out her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy a stock of thread in various colors, as well as some packets of buttons, ribbons and zippers. Then she will be able to meet the demand from her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in various colors, together with some packets of buttons, ribbons and zippers.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 37-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. She has been actively involved in the business of selling clothes for the past eight years. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. She wants to grow her business and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs for resale.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a 27-year-old married woman; the mother of three children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is her husband. They offer a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store. Kiran makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower prices. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour for her store from the market at lower prices.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: At the age of 25, Ayesha is an enthusiastic single lady. She had been actively running her own beauty parlor in her community to support her entire family for many years. She offers quality services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her providing the best service, she has become very famous in her street and has built up a good customer list. She wants to expand her business to meet the increasing demand from her customers but, due to a shortage of funds, she is unable to fill the needs of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams  in large quantities for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 48-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has six young children. Her husband's income as  a tricycle driver is not enough for the family's daily needs.

She engages in a food-vending business. She sells homemade fried chicken to customers in the community. She has been selling fried chicken for almost three years now. Zenaida requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy  seasonings and chicken so that she can continue to serve her customers and also augment her income. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to expand her business to become a successful businesswoman while providing her children with good food and high-quality educations.

loans.use: to buy seasonings and chicken .

loans.name: Koser

texts.en:
Koser is a 31-year-old, married woman. She is a motivated mother of three children and she is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, clothing, and health. 

Koser has been running a small beauty parlor in her house to contribute to her family's income. She offers many efficient services to her customers, such as facials, haircuts, and makeup. 

Her business is at an initial stage and she wants to expand her business to meet the increasing demands. For this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy in large quantities more hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening. 

Koser is in her third loan cycle with a good loan history. With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products, but will also be able to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy in large quantities more hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Pierina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Pierina trabaja para un instituto publico rural como maestra desde hace mas 5 años brindando clase a adolecentes entre las edades de 14 - 17 años, actualmente esta culminando una carrera tecnica donde le brindara mayores posibilidades de vida en lo laboral y salarial siendo beneficiada su familia y ella,solicta  a ceprodel un credito para cancelar y tramitar arancel y titulo.
texts.en: Señora Pierina has worked for a public institution as a teacher for over five years offering classes for adolescents ages 14-17. She is currently finishing a technical degree which will provide her with better career and salary opportunities. This will be beneficial to her and to her family. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to pay tuition and degree fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and degree fees.

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en: Bernadetha is married and has five school-aged children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, she cooks snacks and offers refreshments for sale in a school canteen, and she sells some in their community. She has been doing this more many years. She borrowed 5,700 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to buy ingredients. She hopes to see her children successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make snacks for sale in a school canteen.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia had a difficult time after the failure of her husband’s business. Eight years ago, she started sewing clothes to support her entire family. She sews for the people living near her house and earns enough for a decent life. Her customer demand is increasing day by day but, due to a shortage of funds she is unable to complete the orders of her customers on time. She provides for four children. She is currently in her fifth loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, together with some packets of laces, zippers, buttons and ribbons in various colors. This new loan will allow her to generate more revenue, which she will use on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, together with some packets of laces, zippers, buttons and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Angga

texts.en:
Because his family background is not good, Angga's parents split up long before he was born. To date, Angga does not know who exactly his father is; he knows only his mother. Currently, Angga lives with is his uncle in Jakarta. His uncle has not enough revenue for their daily needs. 

Angga wants to change his fate. He wants to continue his education at a sailing school called the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. Angga’s uncle is trying with all his efforts to help realize the ideals of Angga. 

Angga is very grateful for the student loan program from Kiva, because the difficulty can be resolved. He will be diligent in learning in order to quickly finish his studies. He wants to be a professional employee in a cruise ship company. 

Angga is very grateful to the lenders, who will help him overcome his difficulties.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 41-year-old married woman, the mother of four children, and she is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health care. Her husband is employed and earns a small salary, so she started her business to contribute to the family income. She has been in the business of sewing for fifteen years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of thread, together with some packets of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors. Then she will be able to meet the demand from her customers without fail. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread, together with some packets of buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, of Punta Panaon, Misamis Occidental, is a married woman and the mother of eight children. She plants and raises flowers for sale in town and in their local community. She borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy an assortment of flowers to sell. She wants to expand her business in order to gain more customers and generate more income for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of flowers for resale.

loans.name: Santos De Jesus

texts.es: Doña santos de 52 años de edad, posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 20 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su hermano, doña santos como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su hermano
texts.en: Doña Santos, age 52, has a store where she sells basic staples, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other items. She has had this business for 20 years, and this has given her sales experience which allows her to make the best earnings. Her store is located in her home, in a high-traffic area. She has a large clientele because she has the best-stocked store. People prefer her business and this keeps her ahead of the competition because she always has what her customers need. She sells quality products at accessible prices and with unrivalled service. She is always ready to serve. With her income, she is able to cover some household costs. She lives in her own home with her brother. Santos, like all good businesspeople, wants to expand her business and make a new investment--but she needs capital. So, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy basic staples, candy, eggs, bread, drinks, etc in order to obtain better earnings and to have greater economic stability with her brother.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, candy, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: Maria de 58 años de edad  vive en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior desde hace 5 años vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña María está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más ropa interior por mayor y poder seguir con sus ventas  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and lives in her own home.  She works in selling undergarments, and has been a traveling salesperson for 5 years.  She sells in different towns that are near her home.  With her earnings, she takes care of home expenses.  

Maria is requesting a loan to be able to buy more wholesale undergarments and be able to continue with her sales now that this is her only source of work, and in this way have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Don Elías de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fríjol, y arroz desde hace 30 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos basicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don Elías  solicita un credito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, semillas, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elías is 59 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner.  He works in farming corn, beans and rice and has done this for 30 years.  This has given him the experience necessary to cultivate healthy plants.  He sells his harvests in the farmers' markets near his home, and with his earnings he takes care of home expenses.

Elías requests a loan to be able to buy necessary inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and seeds, among other things, to have good harvests and in this way be able to obtain higher earnings to give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edad  tiene una pequeño chalet ubicado en un centro educativo que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, en donde vende refrescos, golosinas, dulce, galletas y otra serie de artículos a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su chalet comprando refrescos, golosinas, dulces, chocolates,  etc. por mayor  lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old.  She has her own small shop located near the education center, which is close to her home.  She sells refreshments, candies, cookies and other articles here, and through this business she has gotten her family ahead.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children.  

She looks to improve her quality of life, and requests the loan to increase the variety of products in her shop by buying wholesale refreshments, candies, chocolates, etc., which will allow her to increase her business earnings and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale refreshments, candies, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq is a 28-year-old young customer. He is selling food products in his own store. Sadiq is a very kind man; he is doing his best to help his parents. Because of that, he is working the whole day from Monday to Sunday. He has eight years of experience in this field. People in his town are the regular customers for purchasing food products and other available items at the store. His monthly profit from selling products is 150 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat).

His brother helps him to sell products in shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location in the bazaar of his home city.

Sadiq wants to expand his business because this business is the only financial income in his family. For this purpose, he applied for 1,800 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products. He has a good client history, and this will be his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy more products.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy is a 43-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cloths, and with the proceeds she has been able to educate her children and buy land for farming. She began the business to raise money to support her family. She hopes to expand her business to new markets despite challenges of  high rent expenses and bad debtors.

Eddy intends to use the loan to buy cloth to sell.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a 64-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has two grown children. She engages in farming, growing rice. She has been farming rice for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

In order to sustain her farming business, Marciana has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides to gain a larger harvest. In the future, Marciana would like to expand her farming business to improve their living status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is 37 years old and married with five children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife has been working as a laborer. Huyen has been working with aluminium and glass for 12 years.

He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business. He will buy accessories and materials for making products of aluminium and glass to meet his current customers' need and to attract more new customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy accessories and materials for making  products of aluminium and glass

loans.name: Pearlie Grace

texts.en:
Pearlie Grace describes herself as a friendly person. She sells school bags, office supplies and kitchenware. She is happy to serve her customers because she enjoys her business.

Pearlie travels twice a week to the City of Manila just to purchase the products to sell. She is asking for a loan amounting to 40,000 PHP to buy bags, plates and kettles to sell in the market. She believes that the loan will be a big help for buying a volume of products to sell and for earning more profits.

loans.use: to buy bags, plates and kettles to sell in the market.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a small village in Gori district and works as a cleaner at the local school. According to government evaluations, they belong to the “vulnerable poor” category, as the family lives in poverty. Elene’s husband runs a small-scale agricultural business and has a dairy cow and a calf. Elene milks the cow and produces cheese, which is sold from her house. Besides that, the family grows haricot beans, maize and potatoes and uses the harvested product for feeding. 
Elene applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan applications were always rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
Her loan application was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the credit, Elene will buy various cosmetics, including talcs, body lotions, perfumes and face powders. She will distribute these products among her friends and neighbors. She also plans to sell medicines as there is no drugstore in her village. This business will help her to increase her income and profits. Elene awaits your support.

loans.use: to start trading in cosmetics and medicines.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 39-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and two children. She is involved in the business of selling ready-to-wear clothes, with the help of her husband. Her husband buys a wide variety of clothes in the Faisalabad market, then she sells them to the people of her locality at reasonable prices. She has become very famous for providing clothes of good designs and colors. She wants to expand her business and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a greater variety of clothes in various colors and designs, suitable for the summer season. She wishes to use part of revenues to provide good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothes in various colors and designs, suitable for the summer season.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past five years, she has been running a business of cloth sales. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Nasreen is requesting a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees from  Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good loan history. She expects a boost in her earnings with this new loan and plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La Señora Maria trabaja en una escuela publica de primaria desde hace mas de 15 años como profesora transmitiendo una educación y apoyo a niños entre las edades de 10 - 12 años, actualmente el crédito lo va invertir en la construcción de un dormitorio en la compra de materiales como ladrillos, cemento y otros materiales solicita a ceprodel un credito para la compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Señora Maria has worked for a public elementary school for over 15 years as a teacher, providing an education and support for children ages 10-12. She will invest this loan in the construction of a bedroom and the purchase of materials such as bricks and cement. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of construction materials.

loans.use: to repair and expand a room.

loans.name: Asma Group

texts.en:
Asma Group consists of four women who are friends from Sana`a, Yemen. This group is requesting a loan of YER 200,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to increase the members' activity levels. 

Aisha is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old and has children. She has been selling clothes and perfumes in her own region. She has requested a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics and perfumes in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics and perfumes in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es:
Doña Aida con 56 años de edad no deja de soñar en grande y de luchar día a día para salir adelante y para ir cumpliendo sus metas y sus sueños paso a paso. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora madre de 5 hijos de los cuales solo una vive en casa. Junto a su compañero de hogar el cual es motorista y agricultor se dedican al cultivo de café ya que ellos desde muy jóvenes sus padres les enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que en su comunidad es un medio popular de ingresos económicos para cada uno de sus hogares para cada familia.

Doña Aida quiere tecnificar sus cultivos y para eso ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual podrá comprar abono, urea, fertilizantes, foliares y poder dar una mejor asistencia a su cultivo de café.  

Sus planes para el futuro son los de poder ampliar sus cultivos de café, poder comprar más tierra para poder sembrar más café entre otros ya que esto generara mayores ingresos para su familia y podrá darles un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Aida, at the age of 56, is still dreaming big and working hard every day to get ahead and reach her goals and dreams step by step. She is a housewife and farmer with five children, only one of whom lives at home. She and her partner, who is a driver and farmer, cultivate coffee. Both of them were taught this work at young ages by their parents, who taught them to work the land; in their community this is a popular way to make a living.
Aida wants to improve her crops, so she has requested a loan from COMIXMUL with which she will buy manure, urea, fertilizer, and mulch. This will help her to better tend to her coffee crops.
Her plans for the future are to be able to expand her crops, and to buy more land to plant more coffee and other crops. This would generate a greater income for her family and provide them with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Adela Margarita

texts.es: Adela, es estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias Económicas, ella se dedica a vender recargas telefónicas para ayudar a su madre quien le paga los estudios. Adela es una joven de 19 años de edad, quien ha sufrido por la falta de la figura paterna, pero eso no le quita la ilusión de poder culminar su carrera y aspirar a una vida mejor. Solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora, la que le facilitara hacer mejor sus investigaciones que le dejan en la universidad, sin tener la necesidad de estar a altas horas de la noche en un cyber café.
texts.en:
Adela is a student on an Economics course. She makes a living selling phone top-ups to help her mother who pays for her studies. Adela is 19 years old and has suffered from the lack of a father figure. This has not reduced her hopes of being able to finish her course and aspire to a better life. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a computer, which will make it easier and better for her to do the research which they give her at the university, without having to spend time at a cyber cafe until late at night.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Clara Celmira

texts.es: Clara es una comerciante de 55 años que vive con su compañero y su hija mayor de edad en el barrio Villa Estadio del municipio de Soledad. Hace aproximadamente 10 años su pareja quedó sin empleo por lo cual decidieron buscar alguna alternativa de generación de ingresos. Inicialmente, con el dinero recibido por la liquidación laboral, viajaron al municipio de Maicao en el departamento de la Guajira, zona fronteriza a donde se trasladan muchos comerciantes, para comprar víveres y productos alimenticios no perecederos a precios favorables para luego venderlos al detal principalmente entre los tenderos del barrio, amigos y conocidos. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo nuevos clientes que le iban solicitando toda clase de artículos diferentes a alimentos así como ropa, calzado, electrodomésticos, entre otros, acreditándoles con plazos hasta de 45 días, modalidad de venta que aún conserva. En junio del año pasado publicamos su primera solicitud de crédito, sin embargo, ésta expiró por límite de tiempo. Nuevamente la estamos presentando para que aplique a su primer credikiva, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de artículos de catalogos (colonias,cremas, desodorantes,champus) que le han solicitado sus clientes. Su negocio es familiar, organizado de tal manera que cada uno se encarga de un segmento de clientes para asegurar así una buena atención. Su dedicación y esfuerzo han sido factores fundamentales para cumplir sus metas, haciendo de las dificultades una oportunidad para salir adelante. Uno de los objetivos a corto plazo es la consecución de su vivienda propia para lo cual ha venido trabajando en los últimos años junto con su familia. Se siente muy satisfecha y agradecida por todo lo que ha podido lograr hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Clara is a 55-year-old merchant who lives with her companion and her adult daughter in Villa Estadio barrio in the municipality of Soledad. Some 10 years ago, the couple became unemployed and decided to find an alternative means to generate income.

Initially, with money they received for their work termination, they traveled to the municipality of Maicao, Guajira department, a frontier zone where many merchants go to purchase groceries and non-perishable food products at favorable prices to later sell at retail, mainly among barrio residents, friends, and acquaintances.  

Little by little, Clara acquired new customers who came soliciting all kinds of different articles, including food, clothing, shoes, and domestic electrical appliances, among others. She extended credit for up to 45 days, a means of selling that they still employ. Last June, she made her 1st loan request but it expired due to time limits.

Now, once again, Clara is applying for a loan, her 1st from Kiva. The funds will be used to purchase catalog items (colognes, creams, deodorants, shampoos) solicited by her customers. Her business is a family affair, organized so that each member is in charge of a segment of customers, thus assuring good attention.

Clara's dedication and efforts have been fundamental factors in reaching her goals, turning difficulties into an opportunity to get ahead. One of her short term objectives is to complete construction of her house, for which she has been working in recent years alongside her family. She feels very satisfied and grateful for all that she has been able to achieve up to the present.

loans.use: to buy catalog merchandise: colognes, creams, deodorants, shampoos, that her customers have ordered.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 40-year-old, hardworking housewife, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is doing a job as a laborer in a factory where he manufactures types of furniture, such as sofas, beds, chairs, and dining tables. Her husband is professional in his work and is doing very hard work, but getting very low wages. That is why he prepared his mind to start a small business. For this purpose, he has need of some capital to buy materials, such as wooden boards, nails, glue, and chipboard.

Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy initial materials for manufacturing furniture, such as wooden boards, nails, glue, and chipboard. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and bring positive changes into her life as well as into her family's. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor to her.

Note: Razia is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards for her husband to manufacture furniture to sell.

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en:
Hajiran, 33 years old, has been successfully running a small DVD shop in her community with her husband for many years. They offer various types of DVDs such as movies, songs and dramas for every type of customer. They have good communication skills and enjoy a good client list. Gradually they have improved their business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Her previous loans repaid, Hajiran has requested her seventh one for Rs. 50,000 to buy more DVDs and CDs of the latest movies and songs to increase their sales. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy more CDs and DVDs of latest songs and movies.

loans.name: Danaya D Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA D  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont le fonio, l’arachide et le riz avec    BINTOU ,  1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1.25  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo et à Manankoro,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya D group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, one of the villages in Bougouni, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Bintou, sitting on the left in the picture, grows folio (a species of millet), groundnuts and rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of one and a quarter hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village, and in Garalo and Manankoro, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 125 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay labour wages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
This is Maura's tenth loan cycle. She is happy for what her loans are helping her with, especially in her business. Aside from her variety store, she also has a food stall for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Maura would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maura dreams that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to see her children all be successful. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Pelagie's Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwasangapi est presidente du collectif d’affaire  « Dynamique»,  doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 61 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres familles. Son conjoint fut brutalement décédé. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers.Elle installe ses articles au long de la rue,  parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu  de  ses enfants.  Il y a environ 5 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de souliers. Les cambrioleurs, et autres bandits de grand chemin constituent un défi pour son entreprise.  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Mwasangapi, the leader of the business group "Dynamique", is an experienced entrepreneur and doyenne. She is 46 years old, widowed and the mother of 4 children, some of whom are going to school and others who already have their own families. Her husband died suddenly. Mwasangapi is a shoe seller. She displays her items along the side of the road and sometimes at her home. She started her business with funds she received from her children around 5 years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy 2 bags of shoes. A challenge to her business comes from robbers and other highway bandits. She would like to increase her business, feed her children and ensure that they get an education. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for the support it provides in the form of microloans to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of shoes.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 53 years old. She lives in the small village of Gori District with her daughter. Sopio requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Sopio is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a plot of agricultural land where different kinds of fruits are grown. Such as: peach trees, plum trees, cornel trees and strawberries. Sopio and her daughter look after the fruit to insure in a good harvest. Besides, Sopio has a flat which is rented out and she gets 200 Gel per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Sopio requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Sopio has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Sopio will begin selling clothing and household goods. She will purchase clothing and household goods from wholesalers and then resell at a higher price. In addition, Sopio plans to purchase a stock of wood, which will be much more expensive in wintertime. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin selling clothing, household goods and wood

loans.name: Anees

texts.en:
Anees is a 49-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of clothing sales for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for providing good quality clothes in her community. 
 
Anees requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of clothes in different colors and designs for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes in different colors and designs for the summer season.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 42-year-old married woman; mother of six children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of their children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Riffat has now requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 37-year-old married woman; she lives with her husband and three children. She has been involved in the business of clothes stitching for a period of about two years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching clothes in different styles. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

She requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons in large quantities so she can complete the orders without fail. In this way she will be able to generate more revenue which she will use on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es: La Señora Maria trabaja para un centro de salud publico como enfermera desde hace mas de 12 años, actualmente esta realizando una mejora en su casa de habitación como es el cambio de piso dándole una mejor condición de vida a su familia y mayor valor a su casa de habitación, solicita a ceprodel un crédito para poder realizar su meta.
texts.en: Señora Maria has worked for a public health centre as a nurse for over 12 years. She is currently making improvements to her home, changing the floor in order to give her family better living conditions and to increase her home's value. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy ceramic for a floor, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Felipe Alfredo

texts.es: Felipe de 67 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles desde hace 25 años y eso le ha dado el conocimiento y la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista las comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su  esposa y su hijo, don Felipe esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para sus cultivos como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felipe is 67 years old and has been growing corn and beans for a living for the last 25 years. This has given him the necessary knowledge and experience to tend his crops. When the crops are ready he sells them in different markets near to where he lives. He lives in his own house with his wife and son.

Felipe is asking for a loan to buy the necessary supplies for his crops such as: seeds, manure, fertilisers, weedkiller, fungicides etc. so he can get better profits in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers, weedkiller, fungicides etc.

loans.name: Danaya E Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA E  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont le fonio, l’arachide et le riz avec     DJENEBOU  ,  2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo et à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya E group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, one of the villages in Bougouni, 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Djenebou, sitting second from the left in the picture, grows folio (a species of millet), groundnuts and rice. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village, and in Garalo and Manankoro, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 115 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay labour wages.

loans.name: Danaya C Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA C  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont le fonio, l’arachide et le riz avec   SALIMATA  ,  1 ere assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1.25  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo et à Manankoro,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 135.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya C group are married women who average 40 years of age and five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village of Bougouni, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th loan cycle with the MFI, and all past loans were correctly repaid. 

Salimata, sitting first from the right, grows fonio, groundnuts and rice. She plans to use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing of 1,25 hectares of farmland.

After the harvest, the crop is sold in the village, in Garalo and in Manankoro to a clientele consisting of both men and women. Salimata expects to earn a profit of 135,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a battery charger, welder, drill, etc.

loans.name: Santos Erving

texts.es: El señor Santos trabaja para una escuela publica rural desde hace mas de 5 años con niños de educación de nivel avanzado que van 10 - 14 años, actualmente se esta capacitando con una carrera técnica para obtener mejores conocimientos el que le va proporcionar mejores condiciones de vida tanto económicas laborales y familiares, solicita a ceprodel un  crédito para poder solventar estos pagos.
texts.en: Señor Santos has worked for a rural public school for over five years with children ages 10-14 in advanced levels. He is currently getting technical training in order to obtain greater knowledge which will provide him with better living, economic, and family conditions. He is requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to pay for this.

loans.use: to pay tuition and degree costs.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is 58 years old and a widowed woman. She has three daughters and one son. She is happy with her family, because her daughters are married and now Sevda has grandchildren. She dedicated her life to her kids, earning money by selling food products. 

Sevda has a small store in her own city .Her son is also helping  her in this business .Her profit from this business is 120 AZN but it’s not enough to take care of her family and to buy daily-use products  .For that, Sevda needs a loan  of 2000 AZN to expand her business in order to buy products. With a good loan history, she has applied for her third loan .Sevda thanks Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to buy daily-use products

loans.name: Gloria Eliza

texts.es: Gloria de 49 años de edad es una persona amable, responsable y trabajadora, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos el pequeño estudia actualmente y la mayor le ayuda con el negocio, ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa desde hace 4 años, lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene  logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, gloria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor como short, faldas, camisetas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos, etc. y por surtir mas su negocio para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old and is a kind, responsible and hard working person. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her two children. Her young son is currently studying and her older daughter helps her with her business. 

She has been making a living from selling clothes for the last 4 years. She sells as a street trader in the various districts and markets which are near where she lives. With the profits she gets she is able to manage the household expenses. 

Gloria is asking for a loan to buy wholesale clothing such as shorts, skirts, t-shirts, trousers, shirts, blouses, dresses etc. so she can stock her business better in order to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing such as shorts, skirts, t-shirts, trousers, shirts, blouses, dresses etc.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a proud mother of two children. She lives in Bitoon, Ozamiz City, with her family. 

She runs a general store for a living. Her husband serves as a barangay councilor and she helps him in this business. 

She borrowed a loan of PHP 15,000 from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to add inventory capital to her business. She purchased rice and corn grits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en: Inocencia is a widow who has seven adult  children. She is 73 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis, Occidental. Inocencia used her last loan to purchase additional goods to sell in her store. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Recently, she borrowed a loan to buy rice and corn grits for sale. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 55 years old. She is single and lives in a small village of Ozurgeti district with her brother. Eter’s economic activity is newly-started grocery store. It has been a profitable project, but also it needs more support to further develop. Several times she has asked for loans from local financial institutions to develop her business, but without success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of her low income and lack of experience in the business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. 

Eter’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Eter will cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request. She plans to increase the turnover in her business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Eter will work hard, and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. With this loan, her family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need them.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of basic groceries for her store.

loans.name: Eriberto Alfredo

texts.es:
Eriberto es un joven productor de café en una comunidad del Norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y su hijo de 2 años en su pequeña finca de 4 manzanas, de las cuales 1 es de café. Además de sembrar café, también tiene guineo en su finca el cual comercializa a nivel local.

En los últimos 3 ciclos de café, este pequeño productor ha cosechado 8, 17 y 13 quintales de café pergamino. La baja en su producción en el último año se debió a las afectaciones que han tenido las plantaciones de café en el país producto de la Roya, que es un hongo que afecta las hojas de las plantas.

Actualmente, este joven está solicitando un crédito para garantizar un mantenimiento adecuado de su plantación de café y poder incrementar nuevamente los rendimientos y calidad de su cosecha este próximo ciclo. Sus planes son mejorar su finca y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Eriberto is a young coffee producer in a community in north Nicaragua.  He lives with his wife and two-year-old son on his small, four-manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] farm; one of the manzanas is planted with coffee.  In addition to coffee he also grows bananas on his farm that he sells locally.

In his previous three coffee cycles, this small producer has harvested 8, 17 and 13 quintals of parchment coffee.  The drop in production in his latest crop was due to a nationwide infestation of coffee plants with “La Roya” which is a fungus that affects the leaves of the plants.

Currently, this young man is asking for a loan to guarantee adequate maintenance for his coffee plantation in order to once again increase crop yields and quality of harvest in the upcoming cycle.  His plan is to improve the farm and to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maricela Rocio

texts.es:
La cliente Maricela vive en la canton Playas. Comenzo su negocio hace 12 años atras trabajando en la empresa de electrodomesticos. Pero con un prestamo familiar decidio establecer su propio negocio. 

En la actualidad tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 06:30 am. Venede viveres de primera necesidad como arroz, granos, aceite, embutidos etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones en el futuro ya que tiene dos hijos. Con el prestamo quiere comprar medicinas. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo para asi mejorar las ventas de su tienda.
texts.en: Maricela lives in Playas Canton.  She started her business 12 years ago working in a home appliance firm but used a family loan to start her own business.  She currently has a store where she starts work at 6:30am where she sells basic staples like rice, grains, oil, cured meats, etc.  She has many hopes for the future because she has two children.  She wants to use the loan to buy medicine.  In future she’d like to buy a vehicle to improve sales in her store.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
Ligia María es una mujer de 58 años, ella vive en Santa Rosa de la Palmera, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, se dedica desde hace más de 16 años a la administración de su bazar, el cual se encuentra en su casa de habitación, ella adquirió el conocimiento de cómo manejar este negocio ya que fue empleada del mismo durante 3 años, hasta que decidió negociar con el ex dueño y este se lo vendió y a partir de ahí ella pasó a ser la dueña del bazar hasta la actualidad.

En el bazar de la señora Ligia María se pueden encontrar artículos como: Juguetes, artículos de librería, cosméticos, ropa, bisutería, entre otros. Ella con el dinero del crédito desea mejorar la variedad de productos, incrementar la cantidad de clientes y por supuesto aumentar sus ingresos.

Ligia María con el ingreso que obtiene del bazar ha contribuido a satisfacer las necesidades del hogar, además con la ayuda de su esposo, quien es agricultor; ha podido brindarle el estudio a sus 4 hijos, 3 de los cuales ya son profesionales en diferentes campos y el menor de ellos aún se encuentra estudiando para poder llegar a ser profesional y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.

El trabajo que realiza la señora Ligia María la hace sentirse una persona realizada y muy orgullosa de sí misma, ya que la actividad a la que se dedica le genera ingresos propios y además con esto puede mantener a su familia.

Los clientes de Ligia María son los vecinos de la comunidad donde vive y sus alrededores, son personas humildes y muy buenos clientes, a ella le gusta mucho atender bien a sus clientes y compartir con ellos, eso la llena de satisfacción y al mismo tiempo la mantiene ocupada y con buen ánimo, ella se destaca por la cordialidad con la que trata a sus clientes.

Ligia María espera que con este dinero pueda prosperar económicamente, incrementar el tamaño de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ligia María, age 58, lives in Santa Rosa de la Palmera.  She is married and has four children.  She has been running her variety store for over 16 years.  Her business is located in her house.  She gained knowledge of how to run this business because she was employed in this line of work for three years.  She then decided to negotiate with the ex-owner, and he sold it to her.  From then on she became the owner of the business selling variety items.

In Ligia María’s variety store you can find items like toys, stationery products, cosmetics, clothes, and jewelry, among others.  With the money from the loan she wishes to improve the variety of products, increase her amount of customers, and, of course, increase her income.

With the income that she gets from the variety store, Liga María has contributed towards meeting the needs of her household.  Also, with the help of her husband, a farmer, she has been able to provide an education for her four children.  Three of them are now professionals in different fields, and the youngest is still studying in order to become a professional and help his parents with the household expenses.

The work that Ligia María does makes her feel fulfilled and very proud of herself.  This is because her business activity generates her own income, and she is also able to support her family with it.

Ligia María’s customers are her neighbors in the community where she lives and from the surrounding areas.  They are humble people and very good customers.  She really likes tending to her customers well and sharing with them.  This fills her with satisfaction, and it keeps her occupied and in good spirits.  She is known for the cordial way that she treats her customers.

Ligia María hopes that with this money she will be able to prosper financially, increase the size of her business, and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

location.town: Alajuela, San Carlos, Palmera, Santa Rosa

loans.name: Félix Pedro

texts.es:
Félix es un joven emprendedor de 29 años, que se dedica principalmente a la producción de café. Vive con sus dos hijos de 1 y 3 años en su pequeña finca ubicada en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. El deseo de este joven es que a diferencia de él que estudió hasta 3er grado de primaria, sus hijos puedan tener estudios universitarios, para lo cual dice que se esforzará para proveerles educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Desde hace 11 años, Félix está dedicado a su pequeña finca de 15 manzanas, de las cuales 6 son de café. Este rubro es su principal fuente de ingresos, seguido por los granos básicos que cultiva para comercio y autoconsumo. En su finca genera alrededor de 5 empleos durante el año. Su objetivo al solicitar este crédito es garantizar el adecuado manejo de sus plantaciones de café para prevenir las plagas y enfermedades a que se expone este rubro. Su meta es establecer 5 manzanas más de café en el 2014 para ir incrementando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Félix, 29, is a young entrepreneur whose main activity is coffee growing.  He lives with his two children who are 1 and 3 years old on his small farm located in a rural community in Nicaragua.  This young man’s wish is that unlike him who only competed third grade his children will be able to attend university which is why he says that he’ll strive to provide them with an education and better quality of life.

Félix has been dedicated to his small, 15-manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] farm for the last 11 years; six of them are planted with coffee.  This line of work is his main source of income followed by basic grains that he grows both to sell and for home consumption.  His farm generates about five jobs during the years.  

His objective in requesting this loan is to guarantee adequate care for his coffee plants in order to prevent infestations and illnesses that are possible in this line of work.  His goal is to plant five more manzanas of coffee in 2014 to gradually increase his income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to prevent pests and illnesses in his coffee crop.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: Amadeo de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él posee una discomóvil ameniza fiestas rosas, bodas, cumpleaños y todo tipo de eventos  desde hace 10 años con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Amadeo esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar bocinas y una tecla para sonido la cual sirve para la distribución de energía para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que tiene mucha demanda y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amadeo, 44, lives in his own house with his life companion.  He owns a portable jukebox that he has been using to entertain at ‘fiesta rosa’ parties [signifies the girl's entrance into adulthood], weddings, birthdays and all sorts of events for the last ten years.  With profits earned from his work he’s able to cover some of his household expenses.

Amadeo is requesting a loan to be able to buy speakers and a sound keyboard that’s used to distribute the energy so he can continue with his work since demand is high and he can thus provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy speakers and a keyboard.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 26 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es una joven mujer, que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para llevar el alimento diario a su familia; ya que tiene dos hijos por quien velar. La cliente toda la vida se a dedicado a la agricultura debido a que toda su familia se dedica a esta actividad esto lo heredo de sus padres.

Se desplaza unos 20 kilómetros hasta la ciudad, para obtener los productos para su cultivo, viaja a la ciudad por que adquiere los insumos a un precio mejor y no incurre en mayores gastos solo de transporte.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para 10 sacos de fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz; ya que lo necesita para tener una buena producción y así asegurar un buen trabajo y generar ingresos para su familia al igual que tener maíz para todo el año ya que ella esta acostumbrada a moler en su casa y no comprar las tortillas.

Como sus hijos están pequeños, ella lo que desea es tener ganancias en su cultivo y darles todo lo que necesiten y poder tener dinero para cuando ellos se enfermen porque lo que desea es jamás verlos mal por que los quiere mucho.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 26 years old and has a partner and 2 children. She is a young woman who has always liked to work to put food on the table every day for her family, now she has two children to care for. This client has spent her whole life working in agriculture since her whole family works in this field and she has inherited this from her parents. She travels 20km to the city to buy supplies for growing her crops. By travelling to the city she gets the supplies at a better price and she does not incur other costs apart from transport. 

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to pay for 10 sacks of fertiliser and labour to cultivate 7,000 square metres of corn. She needs this to produce good crops and get a good yield which will generate income for the family and provide corn for the whole year. She grinds her own corn at home instead of buying tortillas. As her children are little, she wants to get profits from her produce and give them everything they need. She also wants to be able to have money for when they become ill; she never wants to see them suffer because she loves them very much.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertiliser and pay for labour to cultivate 7,000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Ma. Paula

texts.es:
Doña Paula con 55 años de edad es madre de un hijo el cual ayuda y es el único de la familia que se involucra con las diferentes actividades en el campo como limpieza, abono, corte, entre otros. Su esposo murió hace tres años de un infarto al corazón a la edad de 54 años. La tierra que trabajan en compañía de su hijo es propia gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y sacrificio que junto a su esposo en vida pusieron para lograr algún día tener y trabajar lo propio las cuales están ubicadas a una distancia de 150 metros a la cual se trasladan a pie.

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar mantenimiento y asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café como: urea, abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, etc.

Sus planes para un futuro son mejorar y aumentar la producción de café teniendo como meta la ampliación de sus cultivos sembrando una mejor y mayor variedad siempre de calidad y atractiva para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Paula, 55, is the mother of one son who helps and who is the only family member that takes part in the various field chores like weeding, feeding, pruning, etc.  Her husband died three years of a heart attack at the age of 54.  The land she and her son work is hers thanks to the effort, dedication and sacrifice she and her husband while he was alive put into it in order to someday have land of their own to work for themselves; it’s located about 150 meters from home so they get there on foot.

Today, she’s asking Comixmul for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like urea, manure, leaf fertilizer and coffee formula fertilizer to provide maintenance and technical support to her coffee crop.  Her future plan is to improve and increase coffee production her goal being to expand her crops by planting better and greater variety always of quality and attractive to her customers.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Danaya F Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA F  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont  l’arachide, le haricot et le riz avec  MOH ,  1 ere assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo et à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the DANAYA F group are married women who are, on average, 42 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Moh, a member of the group, grows groundnuts, beans and rice. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village, as well as in Garalo and Bougouni.

She is expecting to make a profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Rosa se 44 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su nieto. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; rosa es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Rosa tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, lives with her life partner and grandson. She owns a tortilla shop, which is well known in her neighborhood. She has many customers because she sells the best, hot tortillas at affordable prices and offers the fastest service. Rosa is an entrepreneur who wants to succeed and has a winner's attitude, which keeps her ahead of the competition. She believes that when you want something, you must understand that you run risks; this makes life worthwhile.

She wants to take risks to grow her business, so she has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy wholesale corn. Rosa hopes that this will provide greater financial security and a full life to her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Danaya G Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA G  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont  l’arachide, le haricot et le riz avec   OUMOU ,  3 eme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo et à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the DANAYA G group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Oumou, a member of the group, grows groundnuts, beans and rice. In the photo, she is in the standing row, third from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village, as well as in Garalo and Bougouni.

She is expecting to make a profit of 100,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica  al servicio de transporte de carga,  tiene varios años de realizar esa actividad, muchas personas lo buscan por ser amable, trabajador y responsable a la hora de realizar los viajes, trabaja en todas las colonias y cantones de donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder pagar ayudante para realizar el trabajo y reparaciones que necesita su camión ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así podrá seguir llevando el pan diario a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his partner and daughter. He makes a living providing a freight transport service. He has been doing this for several years and many people use his services as he is friendly, hard-working and responsible when carrying out his journeys.
