Despite the economic situation she lives daily she does not become discouraged about not reaching her goal of graduating in law because that will allow her to work for herself in various aspects of law.  This is one of the reasons why she decided to study law and also as a way of having other ways to earn income and improve her family’s quality of life.  In addition, she feels proud because despite her age she continues forward.  She needs this loan to pay her university degree fees.  One of her future plans is to open a law firm to provide legal advice and notary services.

loans.use: to pay university degree fees.

loans.name: Eva Esther

texts.es:
Eva, habitante de la ciudad de Managua, es madre de 2 hijos, casada. Ella es estudio la carrera de derecho.   Ella dedica parte de su tiempo a su familia y cuidar de sus hijos que están estudiando la secundaria y la otra parte trabaja como supervisora en una empresa privada, pero sus ingresos no le ajustan para poder pagar su título. 
Ella escogió estudiar la carrera de derecho porque le gusto y es parte de sus metas que se ha propuesto, pues el tener un título  le permitirá formar su propia firma de abogados y trabajar por su propia cuenta al igual ayudar a las personas que lo necesiten en especial el caso de mujeres que han sufrido maltrato o agresiones. 
Ella está solicitando el crédito para pagar su título. Ya que esto le abre la oportunidad de ejercer su carrera y obtener mejores ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Eva lives in the city of Managua; she’s married and mother of two children.  She studied law.  She spends part of her time caring for family and her children who are attending secondary school and the other part working as a supervisor in a private firm but her income is insufficient to pay her degree fees.

She chose law as a career because she liked it and one of the goals she’s set for herself is to get a degree that will allow her to start her own law firm and work for herself as well as to help people who need help especially women who have been abused or maltreated.

She is asking for this loan to pay her degree fees because this will open the opportunity for her to practice her career and earn higher income and provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay degree fees.

loans.name: Bih

texts.en:
She is a widow with six children, and they live in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges, among which are inadequate finance to carry out her business and cater for her family needs, the death of loved ones, and other family issues.

She will invest the loan in buying baby dresses, jackets, and hangers and renting benches. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in this business for a long time, has a good business site, and sells high quality dresses. This business will benefit the community because it will help them to look good through the high quality dresses that she is selling. 

With the help of the loan, she will continue to educate her children, to cater for her family needs, to add her capital for a bigger investment, and also to give thanks to the Almighty God.  She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals as well as the fact that the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy dresses for sale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана рабоает на железной дороге проводником пассажирских вагонов. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Светлана давно мечтала улучшить жилищные условия своей семьи. За счет кредита она хочет отремонтировать две комнаты - выровнять и покрасить стены и потолок. Светлана сможет выплачивать кредит со свой зарплаты, т.к.у нее постоянный доход. После ремонта, который Светлана с семьей будут выполнять сами, они хотели бы провести небольшой отдых на море.
texts.en: Svetlana works for the railroad as a conductor in passenger cars. She is married and has one child. Svetlana has long dreamed of improving the living conditions of her family. She hopes to use a loan to remodel two rooms - even out and paint the walls and ceiling. Svetlana can repay the loan from her paycheck, as she has a steady income. After the remodeling, which Svetlana and her family will do themselves, they hope to spend a short vacation on the sea.

loans.use: to improve living conditions - paint walls and ceiling

loans.name: Zhuzhanna

texts.ru:
Жужанна работает заведующей складом в частной компании Евробуд. Работает уже пять лет, работа ей нравиться и приносит постоянный доход в семью. Жужанна живет с мужем и двумя детьми в частном доме.

В ее доме старая крыша, которая местами протекает. Жужанна просит предоставить ей кредит на ремонт. Она хочет заменить материал крыши на современный и сделать систему для отвода сточной воды. Ремонт хочет успеть сделать летом, так как осенью опять пойдут дожди и Жужанне очень хотелось бы чтобы в этом году крыша уже не протекала.
texts.en: Zhuzhanna works as a warehouse manager for the private company Eurobud. She has been working there for five years, she likes the work and brings a steady income home to her family. Zhuzhanna lives with her husband and two children in a private home.  Her house has an old roof, which leaks in places.  Zhuzhanna has requested a loan for repairs.  She wants to replace the roof materials with modern ones, and create a system for draining standing water.  She hopes to do the repairs in the summer, because in the fall there will be rains again and Zhuzhanna would very much like it if her roof stopped leaking this year.

loans.use: to improve living conditions - change roof to eliminate leakage

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida and her nice family live in the village of Nerkin Hand which is in Syunik region of Armenia. She is married and has a daughter, who is already a student at Yerevan State University. Aida has been a manager, but for many years she has worked at their village library as a librarian. Her husband works in the village administration. Together they are also engaged in agriculture and farming, which occasionally provides a good income for their family. They have ten bee hives, two cows, three piglets and twenty chickens. They also cultivate some vegetables, but only for their private needs. 

This is Aida’s first deal with Kiva. She needs this loan to buy diesel fuel and fodder for her animals, as well as to have machinery repaired in order to be ready for autumn harvest activities.

loans.use: To buy diesel fuel and fodder, and to have machinery repaired

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 48 years old and lives in the village of Tsovagyugh, in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and has a son who has been engaged in farming since he was a school-aged boy. Jemma’s husband is in the Russian Federation and works abroad. Jemma has never worked, but she manages the farm together with her son. After many years of hard and devoted work they own a big and productive farm with ten cows, heifers, eleven bulls, ten calves, and twenty chickens. They also have a large plot of land on which they mainly cultivate potatoes. Jemma sends her farm milk to a very famous company in Armenian dairy products, and the meat her son sells to local butchers. Together with her husband’s occasional help, Jemma’s farm income barely covers the expanses of her family and farm.

Jemma is requesting a loan in order to buy a hay mowing machine; she also plans to buy three cows. She is sure that through Kiva lenders’ support, soon her husband will no longer have to go so far from his family in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a hay mowing machine and three cows.

loans.name: Niño De Praga  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Niño de Praga está formado por 7 mujeres emprendedoras quienes se conocen desde hace muchos años, tienen una gran amistad y laboran en diferentes actividades económicas, las mismas que les dan la oportunidad de ayudar en su hogar y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta bañada por 4 ríos los cuales le dan una magia especial, cuenta con varios sitios turísticos, es de clima frió y su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Dolores, se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Niño de Praga.

La Señora. Dolores tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 7 años que estudian en el colegio y la escuela respectivamente. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial el cual labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es de propia.

Doña Dolores es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a laborar como auxiliar de limpieza, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos de varias marcas, le gustan estas actividades porque le dan la oportunidad de mejorar la situación económica de su hogar. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de ofertas para crecer en este negocio. 

Su sueño es no tener deudas.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Niño de Praga” (Child of Prague) communal bank consists of seven enterprising women who have known each other for many years.  They are great friends and work in various economic activities which provide them with the opportunity of helping at home and moving their families forward.  They live in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca, a city that’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since 1999 and that’s bathed by four rivers that give it a special magic; it has several tourist attractions, its climate is cold and its residents still retain the culture and tradition of its peoples.

One of the group members is Dolores who is in her second loan alongside her friends and fellow Niño de Praga group members. Dolores is 37-years-old, married and has conceived two children who are 14 and 7 years of age and attend secondary and primary school respectively.  Her husband’s an industrial mechanic and works in his own shop; the house she lives in is hers.

Dolores is a very hardworking woman who works as a cleaning assistant and in her free time sells various brands of cosmetics via catalog.  She likes these activities because they give her the opportunity of improving her home’s economic situation.

She will use her new loan to buy cosmetics on sale to grow this business.  Her dream is to be debt-free.

The inserted photo is of a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Monzer

texts.en:
Monzer is a 28-year-old single man, who works in a bakery and has 15 years of experience in this domain.
Monzer is a hardworking man with a good reputation. He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for his wedding and marriage expenses, since it is hard for him to save this amount from his monthly income.
Monzer hopes to open his own bakery one day. He will make sure that his children will have the best education ever, since he didn't get the chance to finish because he had to help his parents in their living. He finished Intermediate studies.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding and marriage expenses.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима 40-летняя жительница района Хуросон. Она замужем и воспитывает двоих сыновей, которые учатся в средней школе. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках в России. Сама Фотима в последние годы занималась предоставлением услуги такси. Она накопила сбережение и теперь хочет заняться торговым бизнесом. Фотима построила помещение для магазина, который расположен недалеко от ее дома. Теперь на руках у нее осталось немного денег и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет приобрести в свой магазин два холодильника и разнообразный ассортимент продуктов питания. В прошлом Фотима занималась торговлей, но в другой области, так что у нее имеется опыт. Фотима верит, что ее бизнес будет успешным и ждет от вас поддержки.
texts.en: Fotima is a 40-year old resident of the Khuroson region. She is married and is raising two sons, who are studying in a middle school. Her husband is currently working abroad in Russia. In recent years, Fotima has been working for a taxi service. She has saved some money and now wants to open a store. Fotima has built the space for the store, which is located not far from her home. Now, she does not have much money left, which is why she has requested a loan. She hopes to obtain two refrigerators and an assortment of food products for her store. In the past, Fotima has worked as a merchant, but in another field, so she has experience.  Fotima believes that her business will be successful and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food products and two refrigerators in order to open a grocery store business

loans.name: María Noemi

texts.es:
La Señora María se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo  Fe y Alegría, en este tiempo ha llegado a establecer una mejor amistad con sus compañeras y vecinas. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de mucha belleza por la arquitectura, esta bañada por 4 ríos quienes la cobijan, esta ciudad es cuna de escritores y artesanos, su gastronómica cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señora. María tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 18, 12 y 12, 11 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus cuatro últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es casa de herederos.

Doña María pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar pero para solventar algunos gastos de su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, los mismos que los vende de pie o pelados. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento de pollos. 

Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora María is taking out her third loan with her friends and fellow members of the Fe y Alegria [Faith and Joy] group. During their time together, she has been able to establish greater friendships with her peers and neighbours. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a very beautiful place due to its architecture. It is bathed by four rivers that shelter the city. This city is the cradle of writers and artisans. Its gastronomy captures the palates of locals and foreigners alike.
Maria is 37, married, and has five children ages 9, 11, 12, 12, and 18. Her eldest is in high school and her four younger children attend school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They received their house as an inheritance.
Maria spends the majority of her time at home taking care of her children and her house. However, in order to cover some of the household costs she raises chickens, which she sells live or plucked.
She will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.
Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Even though Mary grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Mary is an entrepreneur. She sells charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 20 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. Mary has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Kojo is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Kojo is married and has five children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Kojo will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to further diversify the type of products that he sells.

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Kwesi is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Kwesi is married and has two children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Kwesi will use the loan to purchase a larger amount of charcoal, thus helping him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwesi plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more of charcoal, thus helping him improve his overall sales.

loans.name: Nahroud

texts.en: Nahroud is a 43-year-old married father of two children. He owns a business that produces furniture and has 25 years of experience. His wife is currently unemployed, which means that he is the only financial provider for the family. Both his children are enrolled in private schools to provide them with a good education, and this means that Nahroud has to pay their tuition fees on top of all the other family expenses. He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to enhance his factory. In fact, he will be purchasing new wood capital at special prices, which will increase his output, and thus his revenue. As for the future, Nahroud wishes to launch an actual factory.

loans.use: to purchase new wood with special prices, which would increase his output and thus his revenue.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Apewotsika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Abena is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena will use the loan to purchase a larger amount of charcoal, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte de este grupo de crédito Fe y Alegría, se encentra en este grupo desde hace 3 años tiempo en el que ha establecido una mejor amistad con todas sus amigas y vecinas, le gusta también por el compañerismo y porque los créditos son rápidos y sencillos. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de mucha belleza por su arquitectura, esta bañada por 4 ríos quienes la cobijan, esta ciudad es cuna de escritores y artesanos, su gastronómica cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 52 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes, la casa en la que vive es casa de herederos.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, también a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar, actividades que la desempeña desde hace mucho tiempo. También trabaja en la limpieza de un local comercial. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para todos sus animales. 

Su sueño es  mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is part of the “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Joy) group.  She’s been in the group for three years and has formed a good friendship with all her friends and neighbors.  She also likes it because of the companionship and because the loans are quick and easy.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that enjoys much beauty because of its architecture.  It’s bathed by four rivers that blanket it and it’s a city that’s been cradle of writers and artisans; its cuisine captivates taste buds of natives and foreigners alike.

Rosa is 52-years-old and a single mother of two children who are both married, independent adults now.  The house she lives in belongs to heirs.

Rosa works raising chickens and guinea pigs and also works in agriculture for home consumption, activities she’s done for a long time.  She also works cleaning a commercial building.

She will use her new loan to buy chicks and feed for all her animals.  Her dream is to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Jorge Adali

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero. Es un joven emprendedor, con muchos deseos de triunfar en la vida. Tiene dos años de ser motorista de una moto taxi; aprendió ese trabajo con un vecino cuando tuvo una necesidad le enseño a manejar y desde entonces le está trabajando a él. Antes era agricultor.

Con mucho esfuerzo, esta adquiriendo muebles para la casa y otras necesidades del hogar. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para terminar de cancelar una cama que adquirió al crédito
y cree que le sale demasiado caro; por lo que con este préstamo cancelara lo que debe. Así, Podrá cancelar totalmente lo que debe ya que la cuota le da problema y el no quiere quedar con mal record.

Mantendrá una estabilidad económica; ya que debía pagar dos cuotas de este préstamo pagaba la cuota de la comercial y la cuota a la fundación campo hoy solo manejara una cuota.

Planea comprar su propia moto taxi para trabajar y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 25, is single.  He’s a young entrepreneur with a strong wish to succeed in life.  He’s been working as a mototaxi driver for two years.  He learned this work from a neighbor who taught him how to drive when he needed to and since then he’s worked at it.  He used to work in agriculture.

With much effort he’s been acquiring furniture and other essentials for the house.  The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to pay off a bed be bought on credit because he believes it’s too expensive this way so this loan will pay off what he owes and he will be able to completely pay off what he owes because the payment is a problem for him and he doesn’t want to end up with a bad record.  He will maintain economic stability because instead of having to make two payments, one to the commercial firm and one to Fundación Campo, now he’ll only have one payment to manage.  He plans to buy his own mototaxi to work and earn higher income.

loans.use: to pay off a bed he bought on credit.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has been selling charcoal. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of becoming one of the best suppliers of charcoal in the near future. Gladys decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase nine sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase nine sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Araba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Araba sells charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about seven years. She is married to a sanitation official, and together they have five children. Araba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Araba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Araba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of .

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Mariama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling limes in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Mariama is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Mariama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell more limes. In the long term, Mariama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase limes for resale

loans.name: Pucacruz  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Pucacruz está formado por 12 mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican especialmente a las tareas del campo las que aprendieron de sus padres y ahora les permite salir adelante con sus familias. Las socias son mujeres que luchan el día a día en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca lugar que está rodeado de mucha vegetación

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Pucacruz.

La Señora Blanca tiene 31 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 13, 11, 4 y 2 años, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su segundo hijo está en la escuela y sus dos últimos hijos pasan en casa a su cuidado. Su esposo ha continuado con la profesión que heredo de su padre que es la albañilería, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Blaca desde muy pequeña trabaja en las tareas del campo las cuales aprendió de su madre, se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y en especial ganado, también trabaja en la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar y para la venta.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es mejorar la calidad de su ganado para obtener más ganancias.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Pucacruz group is made up of 12 hard-working women who mainly work in agriculture and generally learned this work from their parents. This work now allows them to provide for their families. The members are women who work hard every day in order to improve their quality of life and provide their children with a better future. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people. They live on the outskirts of the Valle parish in Cuenca, an area surrounded by a great deal of vegetation.
One of the group members is Blanca. She is taking out her first loan with her friends and fellow members of the Pucacruz group.
Blanca is 31, married, and has four children ages 2, 4, 11, and 13. Her eldest is in high school; her second-eldest is in school; and her youngest two children stay home under her care. Her husband has followed in his father's footsteps as a bricklayer. They live in their own home.
Blanca has done farmwork from a very young age. She learned this work from her mother. She raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and livestock. She also farms for her family's consumption and for sale.
She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of seeds, manure, and animal feed.
Her goal is to improve the quality of her animals in order to obtain a greater income.
The small inserted photo is of a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, and animal feed.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар человек с открытой душой. Он трудится с ранних лет. В то время как его друзья играли во дворе, он помогал родителям по переработки абрикоса. Повзрослев он начал заниматься переработкой абрикоса самостоятельно. Он, так как имеет большой опыт, ведет свой бизнес успешно. Он покупает абрикосы, перерабатывает абрикосы и продает в виде сухофрукта на местном рынке. Он знает все тонкости своего бизнеса и поэтому его товар имеет хорошее качество. Введению бизнеса его жена Гулзора помогает ему. Его жена очень трудолюбивая женщина и они на воспитании имеют 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Дети Малика и Амир.  Малике 1,5 года и Амиру 3 года. Анвар старается обеспечить свою семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Он хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2050 долларов США для покупки абрикоса. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Anvar is a person with an earnest soul. He has been working hard from a young age. While his friends were playing in the yard, he was helping his parents process apricots. As he became older, he began working in apricot processing on his own. Because he has a lot of experience, he is successful in his business. He purchases apricots, processes them, and sells them as dried fruit at the local market. He is familiar with all the details of his business, so his product is of high quality. His wife Gulzora helps him with the business.  His wife is a very hardworking woman, and they are raising 2 young children. The children are named Malika and Amir.  Malika is 1.5 years old and Amir is 3 years old. Anvar is trying to provide his family with all the necessities. He wants to increase his working capital and thus increase his income. He is asking for a loan in the sum of 2050 U.S. dollars in order to purchase apricots.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy apricots for processing

loans.name: Rosa Marina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo por el buen servicio que la Institución le brindo y las utilidades que le proporciono el crédito; este le permitirá comprar mercadería tales como: tomates, papas, repollo, zanahorias, aguacates, cebollas, pepinos,  güisquil, sandias, naranjas, piña, guineos, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a brindarle un mejor servicio a los clientes y una mayor rentabilidad; las condiciones económicas se han optimizado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Rosa needs to take out a new loan. She wants to do so because of the institution's good service and the opportunities that the loan will provide. This loan will allow her to buy merchandise such as tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, avocado, onion, peppers, chayote, watermelon, oranges, pineapple, and bananas.
Her previous loan helped her to provide better customer service and to make a better profit. Her economic conditions have been optimized and her family circumstances have remained the same.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, avocados, onions, peppers, chayote, watermelon, oranges, pineapple, bananas, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere más capital de trabajo para el negocio de venta de pupusas y tortillas; este le permitirá comprar quesillo, repollos, chicharrón, maíz, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio  y con las ganancias a logrado ayudar a su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Karla is requesting a new loan because she needs more working capital for her business of selling tortillas and pupusas [a traditional Salvadoran dish made of a thick, handmade corn tortilla that is stuffed with quesillo and cooked pork, among other ingredients]. She will use the loan to buy quesillo [an artisanal fresh cheese], cabbage, pork and corn, among other ingredients.

Karla says that her previous loan helped strengthen her business, and with the profits she earned, she was able to help her family. She says that the economic circumstances of her family have improved.

loans.use: to buy quesillo, cabbage, pork and corn.

loans.name: Raul De Jesus

texts.es:
Raúl, vive con su familia. El, se dedica  al cultivo de granos basicos para adquirir ingresos y aportar a su familia. 
El prestamo que requiere le  permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros; esto le ayudara  a crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar en la agricultura.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Raúl lives with his family.  He works growing basic grains to earn income and contribute to his family.  The loan he needs will allow him to buy necessary farm supplies like manure, insecticide and pesticide, among others.  This will help him grow and have everything needed to work in agriculture.  His dream is to provide better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Inés Antonio

texts.es:
Inés tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero. Él se encarga de administrar una finca de café, también cultiva maíz y frijol, siempre se ha dedicado a este tipo de trabajo es de lo que vive en la zona en donde habita. Él viaja a pie o en carro hasta el desvió donde aborda el autobús el cual lo lleva al pueblo de en donde compra su abono para su cultivo.

      El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres sacos de abono, fertilizantes para la milpa, pesticidas para la plaga y la otra parte la utilizara para gastos del hogar.

      En este momento, tiene la milpa y no la ha abonado ya que no puede comprar el abono;  por lo que su mayor satisfacción será poder comprar el abono.

     Tal vez con el crédito no le mejore su calidad de vida por completo; pero cree le dará una mejor estabilidad ya que obtendrá una cosecha la cual puede utilizar para los gastos y para vender en caso de necesitar dinero.


     Planea construir su casa ya que vive en lugar familiar.
texts.en:
Inés, 35, is single.  He manages a coffee plantation and also grows corn and beans.  He’s always worked in this type of work; this is what the zone he lives in lives of.  He travels either by car or on foot to the turnoff where he boards the bus that takes him to the town where he buys manure for his crop.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three sacks of manure, fertilizer for the corn field; pesticides for the pests and the other part will be used to pay household expenses.

At the moment he has corn planted but he’s not applied manure because he’s been unable to buy it so his greatest satisfaction would be to be able to buy the manure.

Perhaps the loan won’t completely improve his quality of life but he does believe that it will provide better stability in that he’ll obtain a harvest he can use for expenses and to sell in case he needs money.  He plans to build his house since he lives in a relative’s place.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay some household expenses.

loans.name: Murtuzali

texts.en:
Murtuzali is 50 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in a small village in Sagarejo district. Murtuzali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start a family business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Murtuzali is an artisan who works on private orders. In addition he is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a milking cow and two calves, whose milk is used to make cheese products. They sell cheese at local markets for a good price. It is barely enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Murtuzali requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for business start-up and re-startup with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the credit Murtuzali will purchase additional cows. As additional cows are purchased, the family will be able to produce more cheese products and thus increase their income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 39-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working in vehicle repairs, specializing in body work, since 1999.

Mahmoud is a hard worker, with a very good reputation in his region. He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a van. He will use it to transport students as an additional business. This will help him ensure that his child, who attends a private school, will have the best education. 

Mahmoud hopes to continue developing his business as much as he can, to make sure that he and his family have a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a van for transporting students

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Her husband works as a carpenter, but their combined income isn't enough to cover their family's needs, especially now that her three children are enrolled in a private school. Huda works from her house selling bags and accessories to help her husband to cover their needs. She is well known in her region and most of her customers are relatives, friends and neighbors. Huda is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her bags and accessories capital with a newly released special summer collection. As for the future, Huda hopes to be financially capable of opening her own shop, which will sure increase her income and improve her family's living.

loans.use: To buy new summer collections of bags and accessories

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives in Kapan, which is a small city in the Syunik region. She is married and has two children: a son who is a student and a daughter who is school-aged. Susanna’s husband is a driver and he transfers people, on his own track, from the country to their city. Nevertheless, he does not manage to cover their family needs and Susann’s business is a great help for him, since it brings a decent (and the main) income for their family. She is engaged in a trading business selling clothes for men and women and dishes. She sells clothes in a rented stall and she has a small private shop where she sells a great variety of dishes. All these she buys once a month from the Yerevan wholesale markets together with her husband. Susanna has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva to buy a lot of seasonal clothes and a great variety of glass tableware, vases and different crockery for her shop.

loans.use: To buy a lot of seasonal clothes and a variety of glass tableware, vases and  crockery for her shop

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos,  requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita mas capital de trabajo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que le ayudo a comprar los materiales agrícolas y obtuvo mayores ganancias con las cuales logro aportar a su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Carlos needs a new loan because he needs more working capital for cultivating basic grains. This will allow him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies such as manure, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides.
The effects of his previous loan were favourable; it allowed him to buy agricultural supplies and he obtained a greater income for his family. His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, and other items.

loans.name: Claudia Lorena

texts.es:
Claudia, requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo, el cual servirá para comprar juguetes, pitas, capiruchos, CDs, entre otros.
El crédito anterior  fue favorable, ya que la venta de artículos aumentaron y fueron mejores, asimismo su capacidad de pago;  sus circunstancias familiares se mantienen y las condiciones económicas se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Claudia needs more working capital to continue investing in her business which is why she’s asking for a new loan to buy toys, string, ‘capiruchos’ [a wooden toy], CDs, etc.

The previous loan was favorable in that the sale of goods increased and improved as well as her ability to pay; her family circumstances are stable and her economic conditions have optimized.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ylber

texts.en:
Ylber is in his early 60’s and loves what he does.  He owns some land where he has tends to his apple orchards; he has been in this business for about ten years, harvesting and selling apple to wholesalers. The region where he resides is known for the largest quantities of the yummiest apples produce with their very own trade name. 

Ylber has had his two sons work together.  He may expand their activity in the near future, but for now he is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to buy pesticides.  This will be his third loan with the previous ones being paid off.

loans.use: to buy pesticides.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 56 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus siete hijos, en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. Cinco de sus hijos están estudiando y su meta es llegar a ser profesionales. Las principales actividades económicas de José son el café y el ganado, a las cuales se ha dedicado desde joven. La finca de este pequeño productor es de 62 manzanas, de las cuales 10 son de café y de éstas 8 son cosecheras y 2 están en desarrollo.

Actualmente, su producción de café es comercializada a través de las plataformas de negocios promovidas por PAC (Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria), bajo el sello de certificación Comercio Justo. Para garantizar el control de plagas y enfermedades en su plantación de café, este pequeño productor está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos para el mantenimiento de su cafetal. Su meta es incrementar su producción de café, a través de mayores rendimientos y áreas, y llegar a tener un mejor flujo de recursos a lo largo del año.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old and lives with his wife and their seven children in a rural community in Nicaragua. Five of his children are going to school, and their goal is to become professionals. 

José's main activities are coffee growing and cattle raising, in which he has worked since he was young. The farm of this small producer is 62 manzanas in area (about 108 acres); 10 of these are planted in coffee, and of these 8 are producing and 2 are in development. 

Currently his coffee production is sold through the business platforms promoted by PAC (Villages in Community Action Association), under the Fair Trade certification seal. 

In order to ensure pest and disease control on his coffee plantation, this small producer is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy the supplies for maintaining his plantation. His goal is to increase his coffee production through greater yields and area planted, and to succeed in having a greater cash flow throughout the year.

loans.use: To buy supplies for maintaining his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Brenda Carolina

texts.es: Brenda habita en el barrio Sta Elena, una zona con pobladores de muy escasos recursos, ella es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos uno de 12 y otro de 10 años, para Brenda no ha sido fácil seguir adelante sola con sus hijos, su actividad comercial es una pequeña pulpería con la que se ayuda para mantener a su hijos, los gastos de educación y alimentación, ella busca como salir adelante. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para   invertir en su negocio, comprando productos de mayor demanda para sus clientes, los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en: Brenda lives in the Sta. Elena neighborhood, an area with very low income residents, she is a single mom, has two children ages 12 and 10, for Brenda it hasn't been easy to get ahead by herself with children, her business activity is a small convenience store with which she helps herself to support her children, cover education and meal expenses, she looks for ways to keep getting ahead.  This is why she requests a loan to invest in her business by buying products at wholesale prices that her customers, neighbors of the area, request.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, soft drinks, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangos, cassava (yuca), watermelon and mamey.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 36 years old. She has been selling beans and sorghum for the past nine years. She is married with three children between 8 and 12 years old. They all attend school. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane growing region. He has five children and has been doing this work (agriculture) for eight years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming,  'Its a source of income for his financial needs'  His biggest challenge is, 'Lack of market, poor roads.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of  'Maritati.'

Lawrence was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied,  'Interest rate is low.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session,  'Interest rate is customer friendly, it meets his financial target.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Lawrence replied, 'It improved their living standard.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lawrence owns  ' cows,  poultry, and a bicycle' but does not own 'pigs, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 52 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, their 15-year-old son, and his mother. Badri's mother is provided with a retirement pension. Badri requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family, aside from the pension of Badri's mother,  is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, they have a vineyard and 600 nut trees. They sell approximately 1500 kg of grapes and 600 kg of nuts, seasonally. They earn hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Badri requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Badri has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits. with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Badri will purchase a car. After the car is purchased, Badri will be able to trade in fruits and vegetables. He will use his car to transport in different villages, and thus increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and use it to transport fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 35 years-old, married and lives with her husband and 13 year-old son in littoral city-Batumi. 

Maka’s husband is a mini-bus driver and gets a monthly income.  Maka runs a beauty salon and has 13 years of experience in this business. She works as a hair stylist.  Her salon has been profitable but it needs more support for further development.  Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisions the provision of a business start-up and re-start-up credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Maka wants to purchase building materials to renovate her salon.  She will also needs modern inventories and to employ an additional stylist. 

According to her estimates, the business will be profitable and will increase the income for her family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business.  Her family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to renovate her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new ice cream machine.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en: Nadine is 26 years old. She sells various items. With a loan Nadine would like to buy salt and rice for resell. The profits from the business will be used to build her house.

loans.use: to buy salt and rice.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her three daughters and father-in-law, who has a retirement pension. 

Mzia requested loan from local financial institutions several times for her business start-up, but was unable to get financing due to low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Mzia works as a teacher at a local school and receives a small monthly salary.  One of her daughters works as a saleslady at a local market.  It is hardly enough to provide food for the family.  According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mzia requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Mzia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With a loan, Mzia will begin trade in clothing.  She plans to go to Turkey and purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell among her villagers at higher prices.  She will also pay university fees for her daughter. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma was born in 1970. She is married and lives in Al Naser area which is a small area in Amman-Jordan. 

Basma started her sewing business at home, and then she bought a sewing machine to increase the number of her products. She has been in business for 10 years. 

Her sewing machine was damaged because of long term of use.  One of the obstacles that Basma is facing with her business is seasonal and fashion fluctuations in clothes. 

Now, with a Kiva loan, Basma is seeking to expand her business by buying more fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 56-year-old single woman, who has worked as a tailor and seller of clothes for the past thirteen years. She works hard to develop her business to cover her living and preserves a to save for when is is older.

Amira has a very good reputation in her region, with a long and wide experience in her domain.

Amira is applying for her forth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua.  She wants to open a convenience store next to her clothing shop, to increase her income.

Her previous loan had a very good impact on her business, and she proved to be a borrower in good standing.

loans.use: to open a convenience store.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es una pequeña productora de café de 67 años que vive en una comunidad de Nicaragua. Junto a su esposo ha estado manejando su finca de 25 manzanas, desde hace 30 años. De sus nueve hijos, cuatro todavía dependen de ella y le apoyan en las actividades de su finca. Además de cultivar 4 manzanas de café, esta pequeña emprendedora siembra maíz y frijol para el consumo de su familia. Como productora de café está dentro del grupo de afiliados a PAC (Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria) que han sido certificados por Comercio Justo.

Para el ciclo de café 2013-2014, Leonor está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su cafetal, a fin de obtener mejores rendimientos y con ellos mayores ingresos. La meta de esta pequeña emprendedora es reinvertir parte de sus utilidades para establecer nuevas áreas de café.
texts.en:
Leonor is 67 and a small coffee producer who lives in a community in Nicaragua. With her husband, she has managed her farm, 25 manzanas in area (about 44 acres), for 30 years. 

Of her nine children, four still depend on her and help with the farm work. In addition to cultivating 4 manzanas of coffee, this small entrepreneur grows corn and beans for her family's use. 

As a coffee producer, she is affiliated with PAC (Villages in Community Action Association), which has received Fair Trade certification.

For the 2013-2014 coffee cycle, Leonore is requesting a loan that will allow her to ensure proper maintenance of her coffee plantation. This is so that she can get better yields, and with these better income. The goal of this small entrepreneur is to reinvest part of her profits to establish new coffee-growing areas.

loans.use: To buy supplies that will allow her to properly maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 50 years old. She sells beans and sorghum and has been in the business for ten years. 

She wants a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to resell. The profits from the business will be saved.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 23 years old. He lives in Mafraq-Jordan. There are seven people in his family.

Mohammad is studying for a bachelor degree in physical education, and he doesn’t currently work. 

He previously borrowed a loan to pay for school fees. Now he is seeking a loan to expand his studies to obtain an advanced degree.

loans.use: to expand his studies.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José,  manifiesta que gracias al crédito anterior a obtenido muy buenos resultados en la producción de hortalizas y granos básicos, es por ello que requiere de un nuevo préstamo; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: fertilizantes, insecticidas, entre otros para adquirir una excelente cosecha en la agricultura.
Menciona que con el crédito anterior tuvo un mejor rendimiento en las cosechas y libres de plagas para comercializarlas en el mercado, generando así mejores ganancias;  las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado y se mantiene el mismo grupo.
texts.en:
José states that thanks to the previous loan he has gotten very good results with his vegetable and basic grains production.  It is for his production that he needs a new loan.  This will allow him to buy needed agricultural supplies like fertilizers and insecticides, among others.  He will do this in order to get an excellent harvest.

He mentions that with the last loan he had a better output in the harvest, which was pest free in order to sell at the market.  This generated better earnings.  His family circumstances have been optimized, and he maintains the same group.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides, among other supplies.

loans.name: Hate

texts.en:
Hate is a seamstress who works from home.  She offers her services to her neighbors.  

Hate is busy and she says, "The fact that I run this activity from home, makes me like it more. I can cook and clean and take care of my family and also work at the same time. It’s cool," Hate says, smiling. She adds that she should have started this activity long ago, but says she has no complains.  

Hate is in her fifties and is married with children.  They live in a main city in south-central Albania.

With a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek Hate wants to buy materials for her clothing repair and alterations business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her clothing repair and alterations business.

loans.name: Al Omaraa Group

texts.en:
Sanaa is the featured borrower of the Al Omaraa group.  She joined with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Sanaa is a 46-year-old married mother of five children,  She works as a housekeeper to help her husband in making their living.  Her loan will be used to pay for her son's wedding expenses as their gift to him,  She is very happy to see her children getting married but she wishes that they had a better financial situation, so they can provide more support to their children.  She is the first from the right, Olfat is the one in the middle and Karima is the one at the left.

loans.use: To help her son in his wedding expenses as his wedding gift

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car-programming computer for his auto electric systems workshop

loans.name: Lydivine

texts.en:
Lydivine is age 30. She sells various items in her boutique and has been in the business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more vegetables, cooking oil and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married mother of two school going children.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has been operating a retail business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour from her home to her neighbours. She faces a challenge of transportation in her business and she dreams of expanding to be a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of three school going children.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business of selling cashew nuts for the past 26 years, selling  from her home to her neighbours.  She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop that sells cashew nuts in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 3 sacks of cashew nuts for sale to earn a living.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of cashew nuts for sale to earn a living.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera was born in 1981. She is married and lives in Karak, Jordan. Sameera took a course in sewing at the Vocational Training Foundation. She started sewing at home two and a half years ago and attracted customers through her family and relatives. She is planning to expand her project in the future by opening her own sewing store. Sameera's sewing machine is damaged because of the long time it's been in use and she can't meet the needs of her customers. Now she is taking a loan to buy a new one.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con tres hermosos hijos. Desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar para ayudarles a cultivar los granos para la alimentación de su familia; debido a eso es la activad que desempeña hoy en día para ganarse la vida y sostener a su propia familia.  

 El abono para su milpa lo compra en el pueblo, viaja en moto taxi hasta el lugar donde lo compra, luego de regreso la moto taxi lo deja en cierto lugar y desde ahí los carga en su espalda unos 20 metros hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar unos dos sacos de abono y cancelara un crédito que tiene con otra institución; ya que para el ese préstamo esta carísimo y podrá ahorrarse ese dinero y por supuesto cultivar la milpa  que hará que su familia  no le falte el sustento de cada día.

Su deseo es construir su propia casa y nos Dios mediante lo lograra.
texts.en:
Jose is 35, married with three beautiful children.  Since he was little, his parents showed him how to work to harvest the crops to feed the family; this is why that is the activity he now works on to earn a living and support his own family.

He buys fertilizer for his corn in the town, he travels through a motorcycle taxi to the store where he buys, and then on the way back the taxi drops him off at a spot from where he has to carry them on his back about 20 meters to get to his house.

The loan requested to Fundacion Campo , is to buy two sacs of organic fertilizer and to pay for a loan that he has at another institution; because that loan is very expensive and he will be able to save some money and harvest the crop that will help his family cover the needs of each day.

He wishes to be able to build his own house and God willing he will.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of organic fertilizer and to pay for a loan that he has with another institution.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who acquired a loan amount of UGX 1,000,000, is 36 years old and is a widow.  her husband having passed on leaving her with 4 children plus one orphan,  Her business is coffee trading in the areas of Ndaragi Kakanju,  She started her business in 1990 after her burdens and responsibilities had become too big since she was not used to working for herself. 

The loan money will be used to buy some manure to boost her coffee plantation yields as well.  She sells coffee to the middle men who sell directly to the factory.  She hopes to earn some reasonable income to support her family since she is the source of hope to her children,  She is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy coffee husks and mulches for mulching the plantation

loans.name: Ezekiah

texts.en:
Ezekiah lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. He has two children and has been doing agricultural work for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is that it's a source of income for his family needs. His biggest challenges are lack of market and poor roads. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Ezekiah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "It meets [my] financial needs."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. "The interest rates are customer friendly," he responded.

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Ezekiah replied "It will be a means of capital hence improving our living standard."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ezekiah owns at least one cow, poultry, and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito netting and a TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Al-Salam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Salam Group. It is comprised of four members, all of whom are women. They are from Sana'a, and they know each other very well. All their projects are home-based. However, they have many customers, mostly women.

The group took a loan of 190,000 YER. Zainb, the group leader, is a 43-year-old woman, who is a housewife. She will use her share of the loan, 50,000 YER, to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard for her house.

loans.name: Patience's Group

texts.en:
Joyce is married, 31 years old, who finished elementary school,  She has two children who are students,  She sells lining, materials and wax-print,  She started this business offering the products door to door and she has eight years of experience,  She has the support of her husband who is a carpentry worker.

She represents a group and requests a loan that will allow her to buy more products, so that she can offer more variety and satisfy the needs of her customers,  In the future she wishes to see a successful business with more working capital to do wholesale selling.

The rest of the group members sell products like fish, plastic products and cooking oil.  They are requesting for a total loan amount of GHS 3,700 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy and sell lining, materials and wax-print to customers

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is a self-reliant and cheerful businessman who lives together with his family in the city of Kapan. He has two children-his daughter works at the shop as a salesgirl and his son has just graduated school. Kamo’s wife does not work and she greatly helps her husband in their family business. They have rented a stall, which is in the center of their city and near the long-distance trail. In their stall they sell nearly everything: vegetables, fruits, juices, sweets, bakery, dairy products, meat, canned food, coffee, etc. All these items, Kamo 10 times in a month buys from Kapan city distributors in order to keep his stall always full and fresh. All the people around their city know Kamo’s shop pretty well and they recommend passersby to do their shopping from his shop only, since the prices are very comfortable and the variety of products always provide a chance to choose the one that you need.

Kamo asks a loan in order to buy a lot of products for his stall to be able to operate better and with good income.

loans.use: To buy a lot of products: vegetables, fruits, juices, sweets, bakery items, dairy products, meat, canned food, and coffee for his stall

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en la sala de belleza; este le permitirá comprar tintes, lociones, cremas para el cabello, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar sus ventas; las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Marina has the need to request a new loan because she needs working capital to continue to invest in her beauty salon; the loan will allow her to buy hair dyes, creams and lotions, among other products.
The previous loan helped her increase income and improved her sales; her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy  hair dyes, creams, lotions and other cosmetic products.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 40 years old and he lives with his family in the village Srashen which is in Syunik region. He has three children, two daughters and a son. His wife does not work and brings up their children. At the same time, she is a helper for her husband and a perfect housewife in their house. 

Mher has no higher education, and for several years he worked at a car service center. Mher is also a great patriot. For three years, he took part in the defensive battles of his village Srashen as a volunteer. After he completed his military service, he finally got married. 

Today his village is a very peaceful and beautiful place, both to live and bring up children, and to establish a farm and produce agricultural goods. Mher keeps six cows, seven bee hives, five piglets and fifteen chickens. On their plot of land the family cultivates greens and different vegetables.

With the loan amount which Mher asks from Kiva lenders, he plans to purchase several bee hives, animal fodder, and diesel fuel. The loan will also enable him to organize harvest gathering activities.

loans.use: to purchase several bee hives, animal fodder, and diesel fuel and also to be able to organize harvest ñgathering activities

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is single, and has no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other sellers. 

With the Ksh 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables at wholesale and resell them to make a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order  to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.pt:
Vive maritalmente e tem 3 filhos menores de idade dos quais um já está na escola. Salvador é negociante, assim como a sua esposa, que vende produtos alimentares quase todo o dia.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de esculturas para revenda na África do Sul. Salvador tem a esperança de aumentar o volume do seu negocio exportando mais esculturas para revenda.
Ele tem o principal desafio de fazer crescer o seu negocio e dar continuidade à sua casa. Ele gostava também de comprar electrodomésticos e mobília.
texts.en:
Salvador is married and has three underage children, one of whom already goes to school. He's a merchant, and so is his wife who sells foodstuffs almost on a daily basis.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase sculptures to re-sell in South Africa. Salvador hopes that he'll increase his business volume by exporting more sculptures for re-selling.
His main challenge is making his business grow and continue building his house. He would also like to purchase appliances and furniture.

loans.use: to purchase sculptures for re-selling.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

For the past ten years, she has been selling cashew nuts to her clients. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of becoming a bigger supplier of cashew nuts in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 4 sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel de 40 anos de idade, é casada e tem 3 filhos dos quais 2 estudam na 11ª e 5ª classe, com 21 e 10 anos de idade respectivamente. Ela é negociante na sua casa, onde possui um estabelecimento, onde trabalha praticamente todos os dias.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos alimentares como açúcar, farinha, óleo de cozinha, leite e outros produtos para revender.
Isabel tem esperança de ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo  mais produtos.
Ela tem o principal desafio de manter o seu negocio, construir uma ferragem para venda de material de construção e ampliar sua casa.
texts.en:
Isabel is 40 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom attend 11th and 5th grade and are 21 and 10 years old respectively. She's a merchant and owns a store in her house where she works practically every day.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase foodstuffs such as sugar, flour, cooking oil and milk and other goods for re-selling. Isabel hopes that she'll expand her business by buying more merchandise.
Her main challenge is keeping her business afloat, enlarging her house and  building a hardware store in order to sell construction supplies.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as sugar, flour, cooking oil and milk for re-selling.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa é divorciada, tem 56 anos idade e é mãe de 5 filhos, 4 dos quais já são maiores de idade e já estão a viver nas suas próprias casas. Com ela vive apenas 1 dos filhos, de 14 anos que está a estudar. Sustenta também 5 netos, dos quais 2 são órfãos de pais e 3 são órfãos de mãe.
Com este valor a cliente quer comprar cimento, barrotes, janelas, portas e chapas de zinco para cobertura da sua nova casa de 2 quartos e sala com cozinha, e casa de banho.
Quer terminar a construção da sua nova casa e mudar-se para lá pois onde vive só tem 1 quarto e sala, que também serve de cozinha e acha muito apertada. Depois de concluir a nova casa, vai começar a arrendar a antiga como forma de reforçar a renda da família.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos. Diz que vai pagar pontualmente para voltar a solicitar outros empréstimos para realizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Rosa is divorced. She's 56 years old and has five children, four of whom are already adults and live in their own homes. The only child who lives with her is 14 years old and goes to school. She also supports five grandchildren, two of whom have lost their fathers and three have lost their mothers.
With this amount she wishes to purchase cement, beams, windows, doors and metal sheets in order to build the roofing for her new house. It has two bedrooms, a living room, a kitchen and a bathroom.
She wishes to finish building her new house and move in, because the place where she lives only has a bedroom and a living room which also serves as a kitchen, and she finds it too cramped. After she finishes the new house, she'll start renting out the old one as a way of increasing her family's income.
She states that her biggest challenge is lacking funds. She states that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion so she can request more loans again in order to achieve her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams, windows, doors and metal sheets in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.pt:
Sr. Faustino de 27 anos de idade, é casado e vive na sua própria casa. Tem 3 filhos, dos quais 2 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário, e a outra é pequena e ainda não vai à escola. Ele é docente numa escola primária.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de material de construção (blocos, pedra, cimento, ferro, barrotes e janelas) e pagamento de mão-de-obra para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Faustino is 27 years old and married, and lives in a house that he owns. He has three children, two of whom attend elementary school, and the other one is still too young to go to school. He's an elementary school teacher.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, rocks, cement, iron, beams and windows) and to pay for labor in order to continue building his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, rocks, cement, iron, beams and windows) and to pay for labor in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a second-year student. He studies at Gavar State University's School of Law (distance learning). He lives with his family in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. His father works abroad in the Russian Federation and tries to help his family financially. Artur has a brother, who is doing seasonal work as a builder in their village. He, together with their mother, helps Artur in farming and agriculture a lot. They have three cows, two heifers, two piglets, fifteen sheep, and twenty chickens on their farm. They also have a plot of land on which they mainly cultivate potato. Together, they manage all the work around the farm, since their mother always gives them useful advice about farming, and Artur and his brother are always ready and full of energy to work and move forward each day.
So, Artur asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams to buy potato seedlings, fertilizers, and diesel fuel. Artur’s family sends warm greetings to Kiva lenders and hopes for support greatly.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizers, and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. She has three children and has been farming for two years. Her primary income sources are milk and personal business. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'dairy farming.'  Her biggest challenge is 'climate change.'  Animals on the farm have been given the name of  'Maridadi.'

Judy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied:  'Better services.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she answered:  'Low interest rate.'

Her highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Judy replied:  'Milk and manure.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Judy owns cows and an automobile, but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, or motorcycle.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.
